intro: Brizochloa spicata, commonly known as the spicate brizochloa, is a flowering plant belonging to the grass family, Poaceae. It is native to southern Africa, where it typically grows in rocky or sandy soils. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, spikelet-like flowers. Brizochloa spicata is often found in open habitats such as grasslands and along riverbanks. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
